Main pronunciation 主要发音: tuō

Other pronunciations 其它发音: tuō,chǐ

Original meaning 本义: Meaning to drag.

English senses 英语理解: drag, tow, haul; delay, prolong

Usage example 用法举例: 拖把 tuō bǎ (mop)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 1706

拕字的基本解释

拕
tuō
同“拖”。

拕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuō］
［《廣韻》託何切，平歌，透。］
［《廣韻》吐邏切，去箇，透。］
亦作“扡2”。亦作“拕1”。“袉1”的被通假字。
(1)曳引；拉。
(2)指拖带。
(3)牵累；牵制。
(4)下垂。
(5)夺取。
(6)拖欠；拖延。
(7)掷。
(8)披散。参见“拖髮”。
(9)挑逗；逗弄。
(10)量词。

拕字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　拕； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页426第02
【唐韻】託何切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】湯何切，?音佗。【說文】曳也。【前漢·嚴助傳】拕舟而入水。【揚雄·校獵賦】拕蒼豨。　又【集韻】他佐切，佗去聲。義同。　又【唐韻】徒可切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】待可切，?駝上聲。引也。　又【韻會】【正韻】?吐臥切，音唾。義同。　又【集韻】唐何切，音駝。亦引也。　又水拕，猶堰也。【唐書·楊行密傳】作魯陽五堰拕，輕舸饋糧。　【集韻】或作拖。又作扡。

拕字的源字形

小篆楷体

字形对比：

拕字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Hold
tuō

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [tuō]
["Guangyun" support where to cut, flat song, through. ]
["Guang Yun" spit out and cut, go to Xi, and go through. ]
Also known as "扡2". Also known as "Wan 1". "艉1" was passed falsely.
(1) Traction; pull.
(2) Refers to towing.
(3) Involvement; containment.
(4) Drooping.
(5) Capture.
(6) In arrears; delay.
(7) Throw.
(8) Phi San. See "dragging".
(9) Tease; tease.
(10) Quantifiers.
Hold
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Collection] [Hand Character Department] 　拕; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 426 02
[Tang Yun] Helping He cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Tang He cut,? Yin Tuo. 【Said the text】Flick also. [Previous Han·Yan Zhuan Zhuan] Entering the water on a boat. 【Yang Xiong·School Hunting Fu】Cao Canghua.　[Ji Yun] He Zuoqie, Tuo go. The same meaning.　[Tang Yun] Can cut only [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Wait to be cut,? Camel sounded. Cited also.　[Yunhui] [Zhengyun]? Spit lying and cut, sound saliva. The same meaning.　[Jiyun] Tang Heqie, sound camel. Also cited also.　It's watering again, and it's still weir. 【Book of Tang·Yang Xing Mi Biography】It was made in Wuyan, Luyang, and the food was given by Qing Ge.　【Jiyun】Or drag. Also made 扡.
